citation.article-title: Amnibacterium kyonggiense gen. nov., sp. nov., a new member of the family Microbacteriaceae
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Amnibacterium kyonggiense sp. nov.
Amnibacterium kyonggiense (ky.ong.gi.en′se. N.L. neut. adj. kyonggiense of or belonging to Kyonggi University, Republic of Korea).
Displays the following characteristics in addition to those given in the genus description.
Cells are 0.15–0.20 μm in width and 0.25–0.30 μm in length.
After 3 days on R2A agar, colonies are 1.0–1.5 mm in diameter, smooth, yellow-coloured, circular and convex.
Grows between 10 and 37 °C, but not at 4 °C or 45 °C after 24 h.
The optimum growth temperature is 30 °C in LB broth.
The pH growth range is between pH 5.0 and pH 8.0, with an optimum pH of 6.0 in LB broth.
Growth occurs in the presence of up to 2 % (w/v) NaCl in LB broth.
Good growth occurs on R2A agar and LB agar.

Positive for aesculin hydrolysis and weakly positive for β-galactosidase, but negative for nitrate reduction, indole production, glucose fermentation, arginine dihydrolase, urease and gelatin hydrolysis (API 20NE).

Adipate, l-arabinose, caproate, citrate, gluconate, N-acetyl-d-glucosamine, d-glucose, malate, maltose, d-mannitol, d-mannose and phenylacetate are not utilized as sole carbon and energy sources (API 20NE).

Positive for α-glucosidase, β-glucosidase (6-Br-2-naphthyl-β d-glucopyranoside), esterase (C4), esterase lipase (C8) and leucine arylamidase, weakly positive for acid phosphatase, cystine arylamidase, α-galactosidase, β-glucuronidase, naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase and valine arylamidase, but negative for alkaline phosphatase, α-chymotrypsin, α-fucosidase, N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase, β-glucosidase (naphthol-AS-BI-β d-glucuronide), lipase (C14), α-mannosidase and trypsin (API ZYM).

Positive for acid production from aesculin ferric citrate and potassium 5-ketogluconate, weakly positive for arbutin and d-tagatose, but negative for N-acetylglucosamine, d-adonitol, starch, amygdalin, d-arabinose, l-arabinose, d-arabitol, l-arabitol, cellobiose, dulcitol, erythritol, d-fructose, d-fucose, l-fucose, d-galactose, gentiobiose, methyl α-d-glucopyranoside, d-glucose, glycerol, glycogen, inositol, inulin, lactose (bovine origin), d-lyxose, maltose, d-mannitol, methyl α-d-mannopyranoside, d-mannose, melezitose, melibiose, potassium 2-ketogluconate, potassium gluconate, raffinose, l-rhamnose, d-ribose, sucrose, salicin, d-sorbitol, methyl β-l-sorbose, trehalose, turanose, xylitol, d-xylopyranoside, d-xylose and l-xylose (API 50CHB).
The major fatty acids are anteiso-C15 : 0 and iso-C16 : 0.
Major polar lipids are phosphatidylglycerol and three unknown phospholipids.
The type strain, KSL51201-037T (=KEMC 51201-037T=JCM 16463T), was isolated from Anyang stream, Republic of Korea.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 72.7 mol%.
